nodes.bodyText: Do we want to raise the access here? Internal feels like it shouldn't be public.
It should not be, mistake made upstream in JTS (sorry)
Do we want to raise the access here? Internal feels like it shouldn't be public.
It should not be, mistake made upstream in JTS (sorry)
This should be fixed or removed.
I kind of want to keep it, we do need to upgrade each time we change the jts library - but I do want to check the version number of a "normal jar" here.
you know the case being tested here (extracting version number from jar name) is covered by JAI.class above
Is there a unit test covering this?

Yes, it was failing hence the reason for the fix.
We actually found this fix when upgrading to 1.16 and introduced some code in CoordinateArraySequence to "fix" bad arrays. However that slowed down things everywhere rather than this one spot which is the only known example where we end up mixing coordinates.
